{|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country=United States |Ship flag={{USN flag|1917}} |Ship name=USS ''Kumigan'' (proposed) |Ship namesake=Previous name retained |Ship owner= |Ship operator= |Ship registry= |Ship route= |Ship ordered= |Ship awarded= |Ship builder=[[Great Lakes Boat Building Corporation]] |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number= |Ship way number= |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed=1917 |Ship acquired=8 May 1917 |Ship commissioned=Never |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship maiden voyage= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship honors= |Ship captured= |Ship fate=Returned to owner early summer 1917 |Ship status= |Ship notes=Saw no active U.S. Navy service |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= |Ship type=[[Patrol vessel]] (proposed) |Ship tonnage=34 [[ton]]s |Ship displacement= |Ship tons burthen= |Ship length={{convert|76|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|13|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught= |Ship draft={{convert|2|ft|9|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship ramps= |Ship ice class= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion= |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship troops= |Ship complement= |Ship crew= |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=1 × 1-pounder gun |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Kumigan'' (SP-97)''' was the proposed name and designation for an armed [[yacht]] acquired in 1917 that never saw active service in the [[United States Navy]].
''Kumigan'' was built as a [[civilian]] motor yacht in 1917 by the [[Great Lakes Boat Building Corporation]]. The U.S. Navy acquired her on 8 May 1917 from her owner, Albert Pack of [[East Chicago, Illinois|East Chicago]], [[Illinois]], for use as a [[patrol vessel]] during [[World War I]].
''Kumigan'' was assigned the [[section patrol]] designation SP-97 and was enrolled in the [[Naval Coastal Defense Reserve]] on 10 May 1917. However, she was never [[Ship commissioning|commissioned]], saw no active U.S. Navy service, and was returned to her owner early in the [[summer]] of 1917.
